result.execSummary:
The defendant Francisco I Delacruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.
  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.
  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.
  • Possess Short-barreled Shotgun/Rifle, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.28(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must be compliant with any child support/paternity orders. No contact with Robin Ellison. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defendant Francisco I Delacruz in court with attorney Brian P Dimmer.  Defendant Francisco I Delacruz in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Upon pleas to Cts 1, 2 3 & 8, the balance will be DRI. The State recommends WPS on 2 counts, I/S WPS on Ct 3 and 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2/2 in Ct 8. Defense is free to argue.

finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
ZCI
Plea hearing at 03-18-2016 09:00 am

Cts 1-7: 961.41(1)(cm)2-Manuf/Del Cocaine. No contact with the co-defendant, RE.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.    Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions to house arrest are court appearances and meetings with attorney only. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 10-02-2015-DEFENDANT MAY ATTEND AODA ASSESSMENT AND TREATMENT AS WELL AS ANY VERIFIED INTERVIEWS AND SUBSEQUENT EMPLOYMENT WITH APPROVAL OF ZCI.

AMENDED 01-15-2016: DEFENDANT MAY ATTEND AA MEETINGS. ALL TIMES, DATES AND LOCATIONS TO BE REPORTED TO ZCI

Final pre-trial at 05-17-2016 09:30 am.
Jury trial at 06-07-2016 01:30 pm.

Defendant Francisco I Delacruz in court with attorney Brian P Dimmer.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that deft's bond was amended to allow him to obtain employment and just now got enough money to afford an alcohol assessment. Defense asks for one more status to allow deft to have the assessment done before a decision is made about resolving case or asking for JT. The State objects as defense has had all digital discovery and the State is not going to change its offer. The State indicates that this case is in conjunction with another. The State's offer will remain open for 30 days from today's date.

BTC: JT/FPT to be set. Bond may be modified to allow deft to go to AA meetings  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
ZCI
